title: Multivariable Calculus (MATH 2551)
description: Vector calculus including partial derivatives, multiple integrals, line and surface integrals, and theorems of Green, Gauss, and Stokes.

title: Applied Combinatorics (MATH 3012)
description: Combinatorial methods including counting techniques, generating functions, graph theory fundamentals, and combinatorial proofs.

title: Linear Algebra with Abstract Vector Spaces (MATH 1564)
description: Rigorous study of vector spaces, linear transformations, eigenvalues, inner product spaces, and proofs in abstract linear algebra.

title: Second Course in Linear Algebra (MATH 3406)
description: Advanced linear algebra topics including spectral theory, canonical forms, advanced eigenvalue theory, and deeper structural analysis.

title: Probability Theory (MATH 3235)
description: Measure-based probability, random variables, expectation, variance, limit theorems, and rigorous probabilistic reasoning.

title: Statistical Theory (MATH 3236)
description: Statistical inference including estimation theory, likelihood methods, hypothesis testing, Fisher information, and asymptotic theory.

title: Data Structures & Algorithms (CS 1332)
description: Implementation and analysis of fundamental data structures including trees, heaps, hash tables, and graph traversal algorithms.

title: Algorithms Honors (CS 3511)
description: Advanced algorithm design and analysis including greedy methods, divide-and-conquer, dynamic programming, network flows, and complexity analysis.

title: Advanced Algorithms (CS 4540)
description: Graduate-level algorithmic techniques including randomized algorithms, approximation algorithms, online algorithms, and advanced combinatorial optimization.

title: Theory of Online Decision Making (CS 8803)
description: Graduate course on online algorithms and learning theory, covering competitive analysis, regret minimization, and adversarial models.

title: Machine Learning (CS 4641)
description: Supervised and unsupervised learning including regression, classification, neural networks, and probabilistic modeling.

title: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence (CS 3600)
description: Search algorithms, game playing, probabilistic reasoning, and foundational AI methods.

title: Computer Organization & Programming (CS 2110)
description: Low-level systems programming, assembly language, memory hierarchy, and computer architecture fundamentals.

title: Systems and Networks (CS 2200)
description: Operating systems concepts including processes, concurrency, synchronization, memory management, and networking fundamentals.

title: Introduction to Linguistics (LING 2100)
description: Foundations of linguistic theory including phonology, morphology, syntax, semantics, and formal language structure.

title: Objects and Design (CS 2340)
description: Object-oriented design and large-scale software development. Covered OOP principles, SOLID and GRASP design principles, design patterns, system architecture styles (MVC, layered architecture), and team-based software engineering practices.
